text: Justine Henin-Hardenne was the defending champion, but did not compete this year. Alicia Molik won the title by defeating Maria Sharapova 4–6, 6–2, 6–3 in the final. ==Seeds== The top four seeds received a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==References== * Official results archive (ITF) * Official results archive (WTA) 2004 Singles Swisscom Challenge - Singles
title: 2004 Swisscom Challenge – Singles
